channel.title: How To Skin Your Minecraft Avatar (without using minecraft.net)
channel.description:
First you will need a minecraft skin, you can use this one [url=http://up.ht/qvdjr1]here[/url], or go to a site like [url=http://www.minecraftskins.com/]this[/url] Now you will need WinRar available free at [url=http://rarlab.com]http://rarlab.com[/url] [hr] Go into " C:\Users\YOUR USERNAME HERE\AppData\Roaming\.minecraft\bin " Right Click minecraft.jar and open with WinRar Once inside of minecraft.jar DELETE the folder called META_INF After you've done that you need to go into the folder named MOB Now you will want to minimize WinRar and go to the folder you've saved your skin in, RENAME the skin to char.png. Finally close WinRar and everything else and go into minecraft, Log in and once you are in the game press E, you now have a new character skin! [hr] [code=bf]- If anything in this tutorial is not allowed let me know - I give permissions for any user to copy this tutorial on OTHER forums - This tutorial was 100% made by Holyzraker (a.k.a. my_flat_ass)[/code]
Constructive critisizm on my tutorials are welcome, if i have made a mistake or left something out feel free to add to this post.

item.title: How To Skin Your Minecraft Avatar (without using minecraft.net)
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

ahh dude thanks or the skins!

Read full topic

item.title: How To Skin Your Minecraft Avatar (without using minecraft.net)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

RobotMenace:

@CoonHunter, lol, and I joined up here to try and share something I thought I was being so original with. I’ve done something similar with 1.8.1 except mine checks the address of the server you are connecting to if you’re playing MP, if that’s not found falls back to amazon. I was thinking custom skins and cloaks depending on what server you are on.

The idea is possible in theory. The problem is holding a database for each and every server. Then the skins people want to use on said server for each one. This would quickly become difficult to manage, let alone get the support from a large enough playerbase to be worth taking all the steps.

Read full topic

All this is going to do is give you a white skin because you didn’t patch it, also as soon as you force update or play online you restore META-INF and it will delete the skin anyways making this pointless… ?

item.title: How To Skin Your Minecraft Avatar (without using minecraft.net)
item.dc:creator: @ratbagmasta ratbagmasta
item.description:
@ratbagmasta wrote:

Like Nokturth, i use Mineshafter. The only problem i found with it, it’s that…not too often you’ll see your own skin, and sometimes you won’t see any skin at all. Once in a while the mineshafter server collapses, and you have to go through the regular Minecraft.exe, but that’s just really occasional.
If there was a mod or another efficient way, i’d definitely use it.

Read full topic
item.source: How To Skin Your Minecraft Avatar (without using minecraft.net)

item.title: How To Skin Your Minecraft Avatar (without using minecraft.net)
item.dc:creator: @k4den k4den
item.description:
@k4den wrote:

Mineshafter is basicly a proxy that opens the client and proxies the data to the mineshaft server.
the same could be setup here using methods that I have already posted, or from the way that CoonHunter does it.

I already sent Mopar my authorisation server, and I may make a Skin manager/server also. Would be quite nice to set something like that up for here.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Nokturth wrote:

me and my friends use a program, mineshafter, look for it in youtube to skin, you can skin yourself and whoever has the program can see your skin
you just have to log in with the mineshafter client instead of the usual minecraft client

item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:19, topic:405567”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=502561.msg3686481#msg3686481 date=1311883236]
Griefers killed it already, with all this “register with forum name etc” stuff.
[/quote]Was griefing the reason we had the forum login thing? I thought it was just so everything could be better integrated.

All it does is slow griefers down slightly (unless a server+forum mod is online, which isn’t often), and stop new players because they have no idea what to do.[/quote]

It was to integrate the forum and server.

item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:14, topic:405567”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=502561.msg3685143#msg3685143 date=1311796721]

As moparcraft is a non-premium server it would probably make sense to encourage the use of such a mod.

i wouldnt use it since they should be paying if they want a skin

They should be paying if they want to play at all…

That’s like saying we should an online server (paid only).
[/quote]
Because we should.[/quote]

And we should have a whitelist to stop random people from just logging on to grief the server and set up an application section.

item.title: How To Skin Your Minecraft Avatar (without using minecraft.net)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“k4den, post:11, topic:405567”]i’ll start working out how skins work and then I will make something up for it.
Will probably do this after I work out a decent way to Auto-edit the minecraft client so I can do it quickly for each update =)
(if anyone has any knowledge of this, will BCEL be the best choice to modify the methods/constant pool?..)

would be great if mopar could add this as well as my auth system… would be far more legit, and could probably bring in a lot of players =P[/quote]
Lol i’ve already gotten a working mod done. There are 2 lines of code not compiling right. Tonight after work if am going to do more research into it. All I know is without those 2 lines the inventory will not close. Problem is there are 2 methods in the Minecraft class that are called when doing b.a(null) lol. I am working on repairing that class to see if I can get it working.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Skin Your Minecraft Avatar (without using minecraft.net)
item.dc:creator: @k4den k4den
item.description:
@k4den wrote:

i’ll start working out how skins work and then I will make something up for it.
Will probably do this after I work out a decent way to Auto-edit the minecraft client so I can do it quickly for each update =)
(if anyone has any knowledge of this, will BCEL be the best choice to modify the methods/constant pool?..)

would be great if mopar could add this as well as my auth system… would be far more legit, and could probably bring in a lot of players =P

item.title: How To Skin Your Minecraft Avatar (without using minecraft.net)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:405567”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=502561.msg3676887#msg3676887 date=1311294306]

You realize the skin would just show up for you right?

what does this statement have to do with manually adding a “skin” through winrar to minecraft? mabey im reading it out of context

edit: oh sorry, how can i fix that?

you cant fix it, all youre doing is changing the default skin that shows up if you dont have a custom one, and if you do this tutorial, everyone on your screen who uses the default skin will have the edited one

Exactly, the only way this would be fixed is if someone added a mod into the client that would use a second link for skins if they do not appear on notch’s amazon host.
[/quote]

Yes, then everyone would have to use that mod/client as well.[/quote]
Yes, that would have been an obvious part as the stock client will not know what other link to try to go to. I am working on this mod now, but Its one of those mods that will only work out decent if it gets popular.

Read full topic
item.source: How To Skin Your Minecraft Avatar (without using minecraft.net)

edit: oh sorry, how can i fix that?

you cant fix it, all youre doing is changing the default skin that shows up if you dont have a custom one, and if you do this tutorial, everyone on your screen who uses the default skin will have the edited one
[/quote]
Exactly, the only way this would be fixed is if someone added a mod into the client that would use a second link for skins if they do not appear on notch’s amazon host.[/quote]

Yes, then everyone would have to use that mod/client as well.
